post.summary: CheckDisposableEmail checks if the domain of an email is disposable
Returns a list of email event rollups by the buckets
List email events matching a set of filters
Create email configuration for a domain
Create email configuration for a domain
Delete email configuration for a domain
Returns the email configuration for a domain
List lists emails that were sent
Send sends an email through sendgrid: Deprecated, use SendV2 instead
SendWithCustomDomain sends an email using a custom domain which must be configured beforehand

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
VerifyPendingEmailDomainRequest can be called to check if all of the
PendingDomain's records match the values on the actual domain.

post.summary: Get looks up an email using the provided ID
Get looks up an email using the provided ID
BulkUpsert will create or update many PartnerEmailQuota entities
Delete will soft delete a PartnerEmailQuota entity
GetMulti will retrieve multiple PartnerEmailQuota entities
Upsert will create or updated a PartnerEmailQuota entity

ListSendGridTeammates returns a list of people who are "teammates" on
Vendasta's SendGrid account.

v1BounceSenderType.description:
Unbounce sender type is used instead of SenderType because the unbounce
RPC can also be used for interacting with Yesware's SendGrid account.

senderType.title: The type of sender that this request is being made on behalf of (e.g. business, partner)

sendFromDomain.title: The domain to send emails from (e.g. for "test@example.com", this would be "example.com")

sendFromUsername.title: The username to send emails from (e.g. for "test@example.com", this would be "test")

replyToEmail.title: The complete email address to include as a "reply-to" on outgoing emails

sendFromName.title: The name of the sender that emails will be sent from (e.g. for "no-reply@example.com" can be "Example Corp")

email to be checked if the domain belongs to a

sensitive.title:
This content is sensitive and will be encrypted at rest. This means that it will only be decrypted in order to
send the email. This is intended to be used for email messages containing sensitive data: for example, password
reset and one-time-password emails

sender.title: The ID of specific sender that this request is being made on behalf of (e.g. account group ID, partner ID)

domain.title: The domain name (e.g. example.com) that this sender prefers to use for sending platform emails on their behalf

isPlatformAuthorized.description:
A boolean that is only true if the sender has installed our DKIM records on their domain
Unauthorized domains are likely to land in spam and put our platform at risk of being block-listed.

isDefaultForSenderType.description: A boolean that is true if this is a domain that is owned by the platform, rather than the sender.

preferredEmailUsername.title: The username (e.g. -->this<--@example.com) that this sender prefers to use for sending platform emails on their behalf

preferredEmailDisplayName.title: The display name (e.g. Joe Smith) that this sender prefers to use for sending platform emails on their behalf

preferredReplyToEmailAddress.description: The reply-to email that this sender prefers. This will not necessarily use the same domain.

recipientEmail.title: The recipient's email should be included in the response if the recipient is currently unsubscribed, otherwise an empty string and a NotFound error should be returned

emailId.title: the email ID of the inbound message

dkim.title: the verification results of any DKIM and domain keys signatures in the message

contentIds.title: the identifiers for the attachments of an email

contentText.title: the email body in plaintext format

subject.title: the subject line of an email

spamScore.title: the Spam Assassin's rating for whether or not this is spam

charsets.title: the character sets of the field extracted from the message

spf.title: the results of the Sender Policy Framework verification of the message sender and receiving IP address

rawMessage.title: the original raw email message that can be used for re-parsing

created.title: the creation time of the email message

updated.title: the updated time of the email message

mappingId.title: the mapping ID of the record owner

appNamespace.title: The app namespace to use for this mapping. (e.g. "Inbox, CRM, etc")

updated.title: the updated time of the inbound message mapping

attributes.description: The attribute arguments to use for this mapping.

uniqueClicks.title: Number of unique clicks on this link

clickRate.title: Rate of clicks per delivered email

searchTerm.title: String to use for full text search on all email fields

emails.title: The email messages matching the list query

sender.title: The sender to get LinkClickActivity for

normalizedUrl.title: The normalized url to get stats for

cursor.title: cursor can be passed to retrieve the next page of results keyed by the cursor

pageSize.title: page_size specifies the number of items to return in the next page

nextCursor.title: A cursor that can be provided to retrieve the next page of results

hasMore.title: Whether or not more results exist

totalResults.title: Total results found by the operation

v1PagedResponseMetadata.title: Contains metadata about the paged response

type.title: The DNS record type (CNAME, A, AAAA, TXT)

value.title: The expected value of the record

currentValue.title: The actual value of the record

verified.title: Indicator of a match bettween current ane expected

includeContent.title:
Set to "true" to include the email content (i.e. the body)
(WARNING: Ensure the content does not contain sensitive info like password-reset links before sending)

includeAttributes.title:
Set to "true" to include the original message's attributes
(WARNING: this may cause sender-facing engagement stats to be surfaces in the platform)

override.title: Support currently in development: non-zero values will be applied over the original message

idempotencyKey.title: The idemopotency key, if provided, will be used as part of the hash for determining the uniqueness of an email. This is used to prevent the email from sending more than once

transactional.description:
Set true if the user should reasonably expect to receive this email as a
result of interaction with the platform. Set false if this email is
marketing content or otherwise something that the user may not expect/want.

encryptContentAtRest.description:
Set true to encrypt the content of the email when it is stored.
This means you will not be able to see the content of the email
in places like Admin Center or vStore. The content is decrypted
immediately before the email leaves our system to be sent.

customSender.description: The custom sender to use for this email. If not provided, the default sender will be used.

inboundMessageMappingOptions.description: The Inbound message mapping options. It could be used to map the reply message to a specific app and owner.

v1SendGridTeammate.title: SendGridTeammate is a person who has a role defined on Vendasta's SendGrid account

actualValue.description: The record that was found on the domain. Or empty if no record found.

matchedPrefix.description:
If a record was found on the domain, this will be the first "chunk" of the
record value that matches the expected value. This helps detect typo errors.

matchedSuffix.description:
If a record was found on the domain, this will be the last "chunk" of the
record value that matches the expected value. This helps detect typo errors.

actualValue.description: The record that was found on the domain. Or empty if no record found.

matchedPrefix.description:
If a record was found on the domain, this will be the first "chunk" of the
record value that matches the expected value. This helps detect typo errors.

matchedSuffix.description:
If a record was found on the domain, this will be the last "chunk" of the
record value that matches the expected value. This helps detect typo errors.
